messages.title: A strong local voice for Ipswich

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Tougher sentences and more police on our streets
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Campaign for tougher sentencing and more police on the streets of Ipswich.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Improvements to roads and rail infrastructure
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensure our roads and train services get the significant investment they need.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: More GPs and continuing investment into Ipswich Hospital
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support our NHS services to ensure everyone can see a GP when they need to.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Secure up to £25 million additional funding for the town centre
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Secure up to £25 million additional funding for the town centre.
Ensure Ipswich residents have priority for council houses.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Ensure greater provision of apprenticeships for young people
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensure greater provision of apprenticeships for young people.

mentions.candidate: We called to see you today Tom Hunt

issues.education: More funding for every pupil in every school

housing.content: Local homes for local people. Ensure Ipswich residents have priority for council houses.

images.caption: Tom Hunt with a construction worker

leaflet.additionalNotes: Promoted by Jane Riley on behalf of Tom Hunt, both of Ipswich Conservative Association, 17 Bixley Drive, Ipswich, IP3 8NS. Printed by The Flyer Press, Falcon Street, Ipswich, IP1 1SL.
